meanings.definition: Producing powerful feelings or strong, clear images in the mind
meanings.sent1: The movie painted a vivid picture of the hero's bravery.
meanings.sent2: The artist used vivid colors to make the painting stand out.
meanings.sent3: The vivid description of the monster made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of the vacation were as vivid as a technicolor dream.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm was a vivid reminder of nature's power.

meanings.definition: Bright, distinct, and intense in color
meanings.sent1: The flowers in the garden were vivid and beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The sunset painted the sky with vivid hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent3: The vivid outfit she wore made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The vivid red of the sports car caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow was a vivid display of nature's palette.

meanings.definition: Lively and vigorous in character or conduct
meanings.sent1: She had a vivid personality that lit up the room.
meanings.sent2: The children's laughter was vivid and contagious.
meanings.sent3: His vivid dance moves entertained the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The team showed vivid determination to win the game.
meanings.sent5: Her vivid storytelling kept everyone captivated.
